data.title: Fix observer GUI showing disabled support powers.
data.body: Fixes #8750.

data.title: Truncate player names in more places.
data.body: Fixes a few more cases that #9920 missed.

data.title: D2k thumper worm attraction balance change
data.body:
Originally suggested by pchote, this gives the Thumper an inner ring where the worm is allowed to move freely around the Thumper. Makes them much more useful, as you can essentially "trap" a worm in an area but still allow them to attack other objects like enemy Harvesters etc.

By default it AttractWorm should have a Spread of 3072, making the inner circle 9 cells in total. (?)

The exact range of this effect could be argued about, but for now this is a big improvement.

data.title: D2k fixed armour & AI typos
data.body:
This fixes some armour typos, that meant all infantry & sandworms were being treated with 100% weapon damage. Corrected sietch armour and health.

Also noticed the AI had an issue with a typo, as well not having the ability to build the construction yard upgrade.

data.title: D2k Battle For Dune map update
data.body: This just fixes a few mistakes I made, where I used cliffs that looked like rock-sand transitions instead of the correct tiles, and so were awkwardly unpassable.

data.title: Adjust orca sight range and prevent aircraft from flying into shroud
Can't group units under Ubuntu 14.04
data.body:
Hello,

I'm Using Ubuntu 14.04 x86_64. I'm using an AZERTY keyboard, but I tried switching into QWERTY mode.
In both cases, I can't group units. CTRL + 1-9 does nothing.

_sob_

data.title: Add more variations to building explosions in ra
data.body: Followup of #8911.

data.title: Fix the documentation of Explodes
data.body:
The `DeathType` defines which weapon(s) trigger an explosion.
Also renamed it to plural, as we use it elsewhere (it was already a `HashSet<string>`, too).

data.title: D2k Ornithopter bomb damage increase
data.body:
Currently the ornithopter strike is useless, takes a quarter off the windtrap. In the original game there were 5 bombers in a line that did 3 strafes over the target, but since I believe that isn't possible, we should just up the damage a bit.

With 1000 damage it takes a windtrap down to about a quarter health, but can also damage surrounding buldings too, compared to the Death Hand which takes out a single windtrap but not much spread damage. This might seem useless but I believe that because the Atreides gets the Fremen power too, they're both intended as two support weapons. You can use them both together to take out a target, or use the 'thopters to finish something off after an attack etc.

And Atreides get more special stuff compared to the other factions, and more spread weapons with the Sonic Tank and Grenadiers...

Either way, this is a boost that makes it more useful, even if its not a free kill.

data.title: Use ExternalConditionInit to transfer external conditions on Transform
data.body:
`Transforms` is notorious for having a series of drawbacks, but it's still a viable option for MCVs.
One of the recent games of the Big Team Tournament ([SlepinirStuff thread](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=18950)) showed FiveAces using an Iron Curtain on his ally's ConYard when it was under attack. His ally (I can't remember who was playing, but the replay and/or stream video can be easily found) though, in a hurry to save his ConYard, packed it into an MCV a second after the Iron Curtain was activated.
The MCV, of course, didn't have the invulnerability upgrade, and died shortly after.

We now have the means to remedy this situation - the `UpgradeInit` that was added recently allows us to copy all upgrades that currently affect the ConYard to the MCV, which will make the Iron Curtain effect persist over to the other actor. (Note: we need to be careful not to refresh the timer on timed upgrades though!)

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28088354-use-upgradeinit-to-transfer-upgrades-on-transform?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Changed ServerSettings cloning to a more reliable approach
data.body:
Using your own copying constructor in classes without proper maps (e.g. ObjectToObject in BLToolkit) is a dangerous practice. As shown in this commit, one might easily forget to update the copying constructor with recently added fields (for example, TimestampFormat was not copied before this commit).

The more general solution (for simple cases like this one) is a call to a protected System.Object method MemberwiseClone(), which does exactly what its name says.

Actually, you may consider using a struct for cases like this. Structs are always copied on assignment; it takes a lot of trickery to actually modify (not replace) someone else's struct, and it is virtually impossible if it is published via a readonly property. But, since structs are all ValueTypes (which implies they are allocated on stack), it is not recommended to use them without fully understanding their nature.

data.title: AI Enhancements
data.body: Added a new AI bot named "Cancer AI" which uses a strategy of constant growth and accumlating funds as much as possible while building more defenses and new bases

data.title: A few ideas for map editor
data.body:
As discussed in IRC, the following features would be really useful for the map editor:
- [ ] A tile size setting for the item you are placing (useful for ore, could place a 10x10 square for example)
- [ ] A mirror function, so that you can design half of the map and then mirror it (vertically/horizontally/diagonally, this wouldn't have to mirror the sprites, just place them in the relevant places)
- [ ] Range indicators when placing units (idea courtesy of r34ch on IRC)

data.title: D2k super weapon timers
data.body:
Adjusted the SW timers that makes them correctly relative to one another.

I simply timed them with a stopwatch, then multiplied them to hopefully match our game speed. They shouldn't be wildly off, and are at least more accurate than what is currently in place.

data.title: Prevent frozen actors leaking through shroud.
data.body: Fixes #9930.

data.title: Persist old exception logs
data.body: All too often we miss out on important debug information because players are more interested in jumping back into the game than reporting their logs.  We should keep all logs newer than X days, or the last N logs.

data.title: Add special case handling for defined exception types.
data.body:
It would be useful for debugging and support if specific exceptions could include extra info in the exception.log:
- `System.OutOfMemoryException` → the current process / computer memory usage.
- OpenGL-derived exceptions (need a new type to throw) → graphics.log contents.
- Desync (need a new type to throw) → syncreport.log contents.

There are probably others.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28075395-add-special-case-handling-for-defined-exception-types?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Attack cursor can be visible for a frozen actor under the shroud
data.body:
Reported by @penev92 in IRC.

Explained in diff form:

``` diff
diff --git a/OpenRA.Game/Traits/Player/FrozenActorLayer.cs b/OpenRA.Game/Traits/Player/FrozenActorLayer.cs
index 260f502..f4ed2f6 100644
--- a/OpenRA.Game/Traits/Player/FrozenActorLayer.cs
+++ b/OpenRA.Game/Traits/Player/FrozenActorLayer.cs
@@ -97,6 +97,10 @@ void UpdateVisibility()
                                }
                        }

+                       // TODO: If Visible == true but the whole footprint is covered by shroud
+                       // (e.g. from a gap generator, hide-map crate, or debug cheat) we need to set Visible = false.
+                       // If we don't do this the player will see an attack cursor through the shroud.
+
                        if (Visible && !wasVisible)
                                NeedRenderables = true;
                }
```

It isn't immediately obvious to me how to fix this without hurting perf.  The brute-force fix (which we may have to go for) is to loop over the footprint a second time and check against `shroud.IsExplored`.

data.title: Set the default map location to the support dir.
data.body:
Fixes the worst part of #9430 so that it does not block the next release.

That ticket will not be properly resolved until we catch other errors during map save, but that is out of scope for this PR.

data.title: Fix nod05 airstrike Lua crash and update map rules
data.body: Don't call an airstrike while the player has no ground units.

data.title: Easier actor selection in map editor by actor bounds center
data.body: Selects actor under cursor by how close its bounds center is to the cursor and then by how high its elevation is. This allows for selection (and tooltip information) of actors masked by the "Scrin Ship" in the "Defend Crash Site" shellmap of the ts mod.

data.title: Further improve D2k spiceblooms
data.body:
This implements the last missing aspects of spiceblooms, namely only growing/'spawning' on spice-free sand (unless pre-placed in map editor) and displaying the animation of blowing spice into the air when spawned.

Additionally, spice particles now properly target cells free of spice when possible.

Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9866.

data.title: Multi-line map editor tooltips
data.body:
Makes the actor tooltips in the map editors look similar to the in game version (listing faction in parentheses instead of using a flag) with information lines below for manual editing. This should be friendlier to map authors who do not go into the MiniYaml or Lua.

Closes #9883 and provides a stepping stone to #9904 tooltip layout.

This actually adds multi-line support to simple tooltips.

data.title: Added 3 Lua player API properties
data.body:
Added 3 Lua player API properties:
- `InternalName`
- `IsNonCombantant` for use with GetPlayers() to get only combatant players back (no Creeps/Neutral)
- `IsLocalPlayer` for individualized player code (such as setting camera position, or future Lua UI stuff)

Test sole survivor map/branch: https://github.com/cjshmyr/OpenRA/commit/e76cc7729e9895359149357f652c847cadbfa2fb

data.title: Fix lint warning in gdi06
Validate player color when changing slots in the lobby
data.body: Fixes #9830.
